title: About
text:
Hi! Welcome to my personal website. I am Jhonny Capichoni Massante, Aurora’s dad, Katy’s husband, and an ecologist.
After many years thinking about creating a website, I think it has been over six year now, I finally got it! I hope I do not make it a place to only fill with professional information but also some creative things that sometimes happens to me.
I am a post-doctoral research fellow in macroecology, currently working at University of São Paulo. It is hard to define my interests as I am interested in so many things, including, of course, ecology-related ones. I like to think it is a virtue: to be curious about things apparently no related. When I am not working on my postdoc project, I like to spend time with my daughter or reading books.

title: Current readings
text:
“A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies . . . The man who never reads lives only one (George R. R. Martin)”

If I were asked: What do you most do? I would answer: I read! I read pretty much everything that crosses me. From medicines’ information to soap ingredients; from random poorly designed outdoors to every object’s manual of instructions. The craziest part? I very often catch myself reading words backwards and like it. But of course, what I like the most is reading books, especially with dystopia themes. Recently, I have got an interest on books about mythology, and I am reading one about the hero’s journey. I also read books that are called self-help books and books about creativity and writing. Here are the four books I am currently reading (a little everyday):
The first two books are not related. The first book The hero with a thousand faces is about the hero’s journey, a concept present in pretty much every book we read and film we watch. In this book the author Joseph Campbell presents a profound description of the hero’s journey. The human journey! The second book: Atomic habits: An easy & proven way to build good habits & break bad ones is a best-seller about building new good habits and abandon bd ones. I’ve read another great book about habits, The power of habit: Why we do what we do in life and business, which describes the origin and cicle of habits with plenty of good examples. Atomic habits, however, is more a practical guide in my opinion and has been a revealing reading. Here are they:








I also like very much reading mangas and watching animes. My favourite one is Naruto and this image represents it :). This is Rasengan, Naruto’s signature jutsu!

The next two books address academic writing. How to improve it. After a few years publishing scientific papers, dealing with reviewers comments, especially those like “there is high quality information in your discussion but it is buried among many other non-relevant information”. I find these comments extremely important and decided to seek for new ways of improving my academic writing. To start with, I picked two books: one about using storytelling and another about style. Here they are:
